text: I used to run Hooded Hydra and [[!Kheru Spellsnatcher]] in an old Bant deck. I will never forget countering a Krosan Grip with the Naga

attachments.fallback: <https://img.scryfall.com/cards/large/en/ktk/45.jpg?1509840874>
attachments.title: Kheru Spellsnatcher

text: <@U3FV90TCZ> that must have felt AMAZING to do. Kinda like stifling a fetchland on turn one, except completely different :slightly_smiling_face:

Oh yea. I don’t remember if it was exactly Grip, but it was a crucial play in that game and I got to explain how it worked. My friend only said “that’s dumb” with contempt as he moved his spell to exile.

My favorite control jazz to do in EDH is [[Grip of Amnesia]]. I know it's not as satisfying as flipping into value on spellsnatcher, but I've seen so many games where I play it and the target player reluctantly let's the spell get countered because the yard is too important to them.

text: Delay pretty winds up being a hard counter fairly often

How does that work with X spells? Does X become 0?
I assume so
Yeah it does
Yep and any additional costs must be repayed. It's savage.
i've never had it not work. Plus it often chills the board since other players don't want to put new targets into play
It and memory lapse are 2 of my favorite isochron scepter targets.
Memory lapse is pretty good for my build of Scarab God where I do a lot of mill.
Yeah I like it in pretty much any deck that mills, especially if I've got altar of the brood online.
If I was going deeper on counters I'd probably consider it, but there are enough unconditional counters to hit my quota.
Good to hear. Scarab is nasty as hell. I hate it and love it equally.
I was trying to build it in a fairly 'fair' way, but since it seems to generate so much hate, might as well build the Arch-Enemy version
